item.description:
One of the most amazing beach hikes in all of New England! For those of you who have said, "7:00 a.m. is just to darn early." We have heard ya!!! We will be meeting a 9:00 a.m. in parking lot 1. This is the first lot on the left after the ranger gate as you drive into the Parker River National Wildlife Refuge. Do not show up unless you have a big ass smile on your face and are ready to laugh and have a blast! There is a $5.00 entrance fee to get into the park, parking is free.

Will car spot early in the morning for those who do not want to walk the entire beach. There will be many options for those who only want to walk a small distance. If you go the distance the round trip is 14 miles. This is a very easy hike/walk as we never leave the beach. Bring a bag for beach finds and something to eat and drink.

About Plum Island--- an 11-mile long barrier Island off the shore of Newburyport and Newbury Massachusetts. Plum Island offers miles of public sandy beaches and the Parker River National Wildlife Refuge, home to over 800 species of birds, plants and animals on 4,662 acres. Sandy Point on the southern tip of Plum Island is a State Park and a wonderful place to swim, sun yourself or go tidepooling. Refuge information (978) 465-5753.
item.name: Miles on the Beach - Plum Island
